body.p:
State of Kentucky
Taylor county
Y To His Excellency
Beriah Magoffin
Governor of Kentucky

Your petitioner James C Wood begs leave to state to your Excellency that at the Sept term 1861 of the Taylor circuit court he was tried convicted and sentenced to confinement for one year in the Penetentiary on the charge of maliciously Stabbing one Thos Cox, that in the trail he did not have a fair chance to defend the charge that he had been confined in jail for near seven months and had no friends who took any interest in getting his witnesses, that one very important witness for him was absent by whom he could have proven that Cox had a knife drawn at the time the petitioner stabed him, said absent witness was the only person
present as fore as is known who saw Cox have the knife drawn, that Ed Yates is the name of the witness who made the statement on oath as above recited before the court of inquiry and was recognised as a witness for the comlth but failed to attend, that Petitioners lawyear was under the belief that a different witness made the statement above, and did not have yates Summoned for Petitioner, and did not learn better until after the trail had progressed for some time he says it is true that Cox had the knife drawn when petitioner stabed him, that severeal witnesses stated on the trial that Cox made an effort to kick petitoner just before the stab or did actually kick him,

He states that he had no mallice towards Cox that the stabbing occured in a sudden passion that it was done with an ordinary pocket knife and that Cox was not dangerously injured, that his wound did
not confine him.

He states that his conviction was mainly produced by an undue excitement in the community against him, and produced by false rumors as to threats pretended to have been made by him, that one witness swore to some threats pretended by him to have been made after the Stabbing which statements was entirely untrue-
He prays that your Excellency pardon him and release him from said judgment and sentence,
Sworn to before me by Jas C Wood this 16th of Sept 1861

Geo. W. Montague clk
Taylor Circuit Court
We citizens of Taylor county join in the above prayr for a pardon for Mr Wood and would state that the case is one which they believe ought to be favored with Executive clemency --
